segments.text: Grandpa , this restaurant looks really old ! How long ago was it built ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm not sure when it started . But I know it's older than me . As a young boy , I used to eat here a lot .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , it's interesting . Dad told me you brought him here when he was young , too . Now , it's my turn .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah . We are the VIP customers here . So , what do you want to eat today ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'd like to eat a hamburger and a bottle of coca-cola .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Hey , kid , that's wrong . It's a Chinese restaurant . Let's eat something traditional .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Then there is nothing particular I'd like to eat . Grandpa , what's your favorite here ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: The Chinese rice pudding . Your father loves it , too . You wanna try ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , of course . But I think they can make you a salty one , too .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Come on . Don's go too far .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I want it to be special . And you know that I always like hot food .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: OK then . We shall ask them to put some red chilli on it .
segments.speaker: S2
